title: Canaston Woods Walking and Cycle Route

images.caption: Canaston Wood

images.title: Jennifer Luther Thomas / Canaston Wood, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The main access point, from the A4075, with track, bridleway and the Knight's Way footpath entering here.

images.title: Angela Jones / Blackpool Mill, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Blackpool Mill. A 19th century water mill that now houses a tea room and gift shop on the banks of the Eastern Cleddau River. Set in Canaston Woods it is a wonderful place to walk and explore.

images.title: The Bush Inn, Robeston Wathen, Pembs. by nick macneill, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The Bush Inn, Robeston Wathen. A nice place for some post walk refreshments near the woods.

description: Enjoy a walk or cycle around these pretty woodlands in Pembrokeshire. There's 420 acres to explore with a good mountain bike track running through the centre of the woods. It's a fairly easy path so it's suitable for families. There are also numerous footpaths to follow through the ancient mixed woodland. The route begins near Canaston Bridge next to Blackpool Mill . There is a lay-by immediately south of Canaston Bridge where you can park.  You then pick up the Knight's Way into the forest and follow various waymarked paths around the heart of the woods. If you would like to continue your outing then you could head to the nearby Picton Castle Gardens and Slebech Park where you will find more excellent walking trails. The circular Narberth Walk starts from the nearby market town and visits the woods before heading to the Blackpool Mill. The historic mill is well worth a visit with some pleasant trails along the River Cleddau to try.
